newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Malaysia's Petronas plans Yankee bond soon.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia's Petronas plans Yankee bond soon.

text.p: Malaysia's state-owned oil company Petronas plans to issue a Yankee bond later this month or early October to partly finance its domestic downstream projects, a source close to the company said on Friday.
Petronas has appointed CS First Boston and Solomon Brothers as joint lead manager for the issue, the source said.
The amount to be raised from the market has not yet been decided and the maturity period will be decided by the market, he said.
He said the amount and the maturity period will be decided during the roadshow which will be held in conjunction with the bond issue and the market situation will be assessed then.
Last year, Petronas issued a US$1 billion Yankee bond and $500 million in 1993.
Petronas issued two samurai bonds totalling 22 billion yen in May this year.
